properties.areaDesc: Holmes, MS; Yazoo, MS; Attala, MS
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 14 at 5:45AM CST until January 14 at 8:45AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southeastern Holmes County in central Mississippi...
Attala County in central Mississippi...
Northern Yazoo County in central Mississippi...

* Until 845 AM CST.

* At 543 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two to three inches of
rain have already fallen, especially over northern Yazoo and
western Holmes County. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to
begin shortly.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Yazoo City, Kosciusko, Durant, Benton, Franklin, Lexington,
Goodman, Pickens, Newport, Ebenezer, Bowling Green, Hesterville,
Brozville, Zama, Howard, Holly Bluff, Mcadams, Possumneck, Smyrna
and Coxburg.

Additional rainfall amounts of one to three inches are possible in
the warned area.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 8:45 AM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
